dbms.bplus
Class PrimaryBPlusTree

java.lang.Object
  dbms.bplus.PrimaryBPlusTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PrimaryBPlusTree
extends Object
implements Serializable

Implemenents a B+ Tree that is being used as a primary index in our DBMS System.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

root

private Node root
The root node.

firstLeaf

private PrimaryLeaf firstLeaf
The first leaf PrimaryLeaf of our B+ Tree.

bucketFactor

private final int bucketFactor
The bucket factor.

bucketFactorDiv2

private final int bucketFactorDiv2
The ceiling of the number of bucket factor divided by 2. It is used to define the maximum number of children a node in our B+ tree can have.

nextPageNumber

private int nextPageNumber
The next page number.

emptyRecord

private final Record emptyRecord
An empty record.

Constructor Detail

PrimaryBPlusTree

public PrimaryBPlusTree(int bucketFactor,
                        Record emptyRecord)
Creates the primary B+ tree by assigning the bucket factor and an empty record taken from parameters and making the root and first leaf point at the same node.

Parameters:
bucketFactor - The bucket factor.
emptyRecord - An empty record.
Method Detail

search

private PrimaryLeaf search(int key)
Searches for a primary leaf using its key. When the primary leaf is found it is returned.

Parameters:
key - The key of the primary leaf-target.
Returns:
The desired PrimaryLeaf.

insert

public Object[] insert(Record newRecord)
Inserts a new record to the appropriate position inside the Primary B+ Tree.

Parameters:
newRecord - The record to be inserted.
Returns:
Information on the succesful insertion and on the update of the secondary indexes.

splitPage

private Page splitPage(Page currentPage,
                       PrimaryLeaf currentLeaf,
                       PrimaryLeaf newLeaf,
                       LinkedList<Record> recordsMoved,
                       LinkedList<Reference> oldStatusList,
                       LinkedList<Reference> newStatusList)
Splits a replete page into two pages in order for the new record to be inserted. After the spliting of the first page in two, the first page contains bucketFactorDiv2 elements and the second page the rest. Information is gathered regarding the necessary update of the secondary indexes.

Parameters:
currentPage - The current page that is replete.
currentLeaf - The current leaf.
newLeaf - A new leaf to host (bucketFactorDiv2 + 1) records.
recordsMoved - The records that were moved. We need them to update the secondary indexes.
oldStatusList - The old status of the list of records.
newStatusList - The new status of the list of records.
Returns:
The new page.

splitPrimaryLeaf

private PrimaryLeaf splitPrimaryLeaf(PrimaryLeaf currentLeaf)
Splits a primary leaf to two and then the children's connections between them and their neighbours are being adjusted.

Parameters:
currentLeaf - The current primary leaf.
Returns:
The new primary leaf.

reconstructTree

private void reconstructTree(PrimaryLeaf currentLeaf,
                             PrimaryLeaf newLeaf,
                             Page newPage)
Reconstructs the tree in order to adjust it to changes that may have happened (after a page and a primary leaf is split).

Parameters:
currentLeaf - The current leaf.
newLeaf - The new leaf.
newPage - The new page.

createNewParent

private void createNewParent(Node firstChild,
                             Node secondChild,
                             int key)
When the tree is being reconstructed some nodes may not have a parent. This method constructs a new parent and connects it to the orphan node(s).

Parameters:
firstChild - The first child.
secondChild - The second child.
key - The key of the Nodes

reconstructInnerNodes

private void reconstructInnerNodes(int key,
                                   InnerNode currentNode,
                                   Node newNode)
Reconstructs inner nodes after new nodes have been created (possibly from a split procedure). Checks if a repletion takes place too.

Parameters:
key - The current node's key.
currentNode - The current node.
newNode - The new node.

splitInnerNode

private InnerNode splitInnerNode(InnerNode currentNode)
Splits an inner node to two and places half the children to the first and the other to the second. The parent(s) are being updated too.

Parameters:
currentNode - The node to be splited.
Returns:
The new InnerNode.

delete

public Object[] delete(int primaryKey)
Deletes a record (With key equal to the PrimaryKey) and updates the information of the primary B+ Tree, of the references which were changed and of the hard disk as well.

Parameters:
primaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion.
  • A LinkedList object with the deleted records and their position.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

deleteAllGreaterOrEqual

public Object[] deleteAllGreaterOrEqual(int primaryKey)
Same as the delete method, only here we delete all the records with key greater or equal to the PrimaryKey. We also do not update references beacause of the way that this kind of deletion takes place. It does not move any records inside the page.

Parameters:
primaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion
  • A LinkedList object with the deleted records and their positions.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion (they are not used in this method).

deleteAllLessOrEqual

public Object[] deleteAllLessOrEqual(int primaryKey)
Same as the delete method except here it deletes all the records with key of lesser or equal value to the PrimaryKey. Then updates the information of the primary B+ Tree, of the references which were changed and of the hard disk as well.

Parameters:
primaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion.
  • A LinkedList object with the deleted records and their positions.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

delete

public Object[] delete(LinkedList<Reference> referenceList)
It is used to delete records after a deletion made in a secondary index. It then collects information about updating the references of the secondary indexes.

Parameters:
referenceList - The list with the references that were deleted from a secondary index
Returns:
A Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion.
  • A LinkedList object with the deleted records and their positions.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

delete

public Object[] delete(int secondaryKey,
                       int keyIndex)
Deletes records using the secondaryKey. It then collects information about updating all references needed. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired secondary key.
keyIndex - The desired key's index.
Returns:
A Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion.
  • A LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

deleteAllGreater

public Object[] deleteAllGreater(int secondaryKey,
                                 int keyIndex)
Same as the delete method, only here it deletes all the records with key greater to the secondary key given to the parameter. Then updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired secondary key
keyIndex - the desired key index
Returns:
A Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion.
  • A LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

deleteAllLess

public Object[] deleteAllLess(int secondaryKey,
                              int keyIndex)
Same as the delete method, only here it deletes all the records with key lesser to the secondary key given to the parameter. Then updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired secondary key.
keyIndex - The desired key index.
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion.
  • A LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

delete

public Object[] delete(String key,
                       int keyIndex)
Same as the delete method, only here it deletes all the records with a string key equal to the string key given to the parameter. Then updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
key - String key according to which the deletions will be done.
keyIndex - The index of the key
Returns:
A Result [5] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the deletion.
  • A LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records.
  • Three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

find

public Object[] find(int primaryKey)
Finds a record (the one with key equal to primaryKey) and returns it.

Parameters:
primaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the record that was chosen.

findAllGreaterOrEqual

public Object[] findAllGreaterOrEqual(int primaryKey)
Same as the find method,only here it searches for all the records with key greater or equal to the one given to the parameter.

Parameters:
primaryKey - The desired key,
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the succeded of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

findAllLessOrEqual

public Object[] findAllLessOrEqual(int primaryKey)
Same as the find method, only here it searches for all the records with key lesser or equal to the one given to the parameter.

Parameters:
primaryKey - The desired key
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the succeded of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

find

public Object[] find(LinkedList<Reference> referenceList)
Finds records after a call of findin a secondary index.

Parameters:
referenceList - The list with the references that we want to find
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

find

public Object[] find(int secondaryKey,
                     int keyIndex)
Finds records using the secondaryKey. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired secondary key.
keyIndex - The desired key's index.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

findAllGreater

public Object[] findAllGreater(int secondaryKey,
                               int keyIndex)
Same as the find method, except that it finds all the records with key greater to the secondaryKey. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired secondary key.
keyIndex - The desired key index.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

findAllLess

public Object[] findAllLess(int secondaryKey,
                            int keyIndex)
Same as the find method,except that it finds all the records with key lesser to the secondaryKey. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired secondary key.
keyIndex - The desired key index.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

find

public Object[] find(String key,
                     int keyIndex)
Same as the find method, except that it finds all the records with a value equal to key. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
key - String key according to which, the deletions will be done.
keyIndex - The index of the key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the succes of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

findAllInRange

public Object[] findAllInRange(int firstPrimaryKey,
                               int lastPrimaryKey)
Same as the find method, except that it finds all the records in the open range between the firstPrimaryKey and lastPrimaryKey.

Parameters:
firstPrimaryKey - The first key.
lastPrimaryKey - The last key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.

findAllInRange

public Object[] findAllInRange(int firstSecondaryKey,
                               int lastSecondaryKey,
                               int keyIndex)
Same as the find method, except that it finds all the records in the open range between the firstSecondaryKey and lastSecondaryKey. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
firstSecondaryKey - The first key.
lastSecondaryKey - The secondary key.
keyIndex - The index of the key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search proccess.
  • A LinkedList object with the records that were chosen.
